meanings.definition: Showing or having a cunning or deceitful nature.
meanings.sent1: The fox was the shiftiest animal in the forest, always finding a way to outsmart the other creatures.
meanings.sent2: The detective knew the suspect was up to something when he noticed the shiftiest look in his eyes.
meanings.sent3: The shiftiest squirrel in the park managed to steal all the nuts without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the shiftiest thing about her, hiding her true intentions behind a facade of innocence.
meanings.sent5: The shiftiest character in the story turned out to be the one who held the key to solving the mystery.

meanings.definition: Moving or changing position quickly or frequently.
meanings.sent1: The shiftiest shadows danced across the wall as the candle flickered in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The shiftiest clouds in the sky seemed to be racing against each other, constantly changing shapes.
meanings.sent3: The shiftiest cat in the neighborhood was known for its ability to dart in and out of hiding spots in a flash.
meanings.sent4: The shiftiest river in the valley twisted and turned, never staying in one place for long.
meanings.sent5: The shiftiest wind blew through the trees, causing the leaves to rustle and sway unpredictably.
